sub_topic: Identifying the type of inorganic solid (ionic, covalent, metallic)
message_1: Identify the type of inorganic solid that is formed between sulfur and oxygen in the compound SO2.
message_2: Sulfur dioxide (SO2) is not an inorganic solid. It is a gaseous compound at room temperature, consisting of one sulfur atom and two oxygen atoms. It is a covalent molecular compound, as the atoms within the molecule are held together by covalent bonds.
